tool.name: Unique lines
tool.command:
uniq -f $skipfields $count $repeated $ignorecase $uniqueonly $input
## feature is not yet released, it will be in the next 8.22 version ##--group=$group
#if $count: # count will print the count with spaces infrontof the line and # with a space (not a tab) after the number, we need to cahnge that | sed -e 's/ *//' -e 's/ /\t/' > $output #end if > $output

param.name: input
param.label: File to scan for unique values
param.help: Make sure you have sorted this file

param.name: count
param.label: Counting number of occurrences [-c]
param.help: Prefix lines by the number of occurrences

param.name: ignorecase
param.label: Ignore differences in case when comparing [-i]

param.name: skipfields
param.label: Avoid comparing the first N fields [-f]
param.help: Use zero to start from the first field

tool.help:
This tool takes a sorted file and look for lines that are unique.
.. class:: warningmark
Please make sure your file is sorted, or else this tool will give you an erroneous output.
.. class:: infomark
You can sort your file using either the "Sort" tool in "Filter and Sort", or the "Sort" tool in "Unix Tools".
